file_content.text: The depot still smolders from our air strike, as does the Republic's temper.
The air strike destroyed the Republic's armor depot.
Word just reached my ear! A panicked Republic officer transmitted a distress signal, warning of the lone destroyer who rained fire on their base.
Word travels fast. Republic Command sent out an amusing distress call, warning of the lethal Imperial forces who destroyed their operations.
I'll cite your impressive--excuse me.
The Republic's discussing defensive tactics on unsecure channels. Fools. Please pardon me, I can't miss a word of this.
I'm plugged into Republic comm frequencies. They don't suspect a thing.
Hold a moment. Scanning signals... wait for it... there!
Agent Brayso, at your service, my lord. I'm pleased to report that the Republic once again failed to evade my surveillance.
Agent Brayso, sir. Surveillance chief. Once more, Republic security falls to my methods.
You just witnessed an act of brilliance, merc. No Republic transmissions are safe from me.
The Republic thought their state-of-the-art encryption algorithms could stop me. As always, they were wrong.
I shattered their communication defenses and discovered their latest secret. Apparently, the Republic's converted an old estate into an armor depot.
That depot is a blight on Taris and an insult to Imperial devastation. We must respond in force.
Inform Imperial Command.
Darth Gravus has already made his intentions clear.
Surely the Empire has enough firepower to level a simple armory.
Burn the depot to the ground.
That's just what protocol calls for, my lord.
You're to be commended, agent. Now, where is this depot?
Excellent work.
Thank you, sir. It's close, but well protected.
A secret armory could've been supplying the Republic and scavengers for months.
That's not good.
I'm well aware, hunter. That is why we must act immediately.
Could this be a trap?
If the Republic wanted to trick us, they wouldn't have encrypted their intel so securely.
An armor depot? So what?
This is sensitive, grade A intelligence. I'm informing you because we must retaliate at once.
Per Directive 629-1, Republic structures aiding Taris's restoration are subject to destruction. I initiated an air strike, but the Republic's disrupting my equipment.
We have only one alternative: Someone must infiltrate the Republic base, disable their signal jammers and then manually call in the air strike.
I'll give you your air strike.
Brilliant. I'd hate to see such fantastic intel go to waste.
Finally, a worthy task.
Does this air strike pay well?
Intelligence will arrange something, hunter. Payable on impact, of course.
Knock out the Republic's jammers, then use this laser designator from high ground. The Imperial fleet will take care of the rest.
You call it in. [Refuse quest]
My talents are best suited for surveillance work. If you won't help, perhaps another will.
Please, I'm on surveillance duty.
